ratings.comment: Professor Gillis is one of the best professors I have had in undergrad. You can tell he is passionate about the topics we talk about, and makes class very interesting. The class had a few required books but all of them were relevant to the class and made discussion more interesting.

Professor Gillis was easily my favorite professor in undergrad. He's extremely passionate about the lecture topics and it shows. The lectures are well organized and the exams are pretty easy if you pay attention in lecture and do the readings (which are interesting and easy). I would definitely recommend taking his course to everyone!!!

PROFESSOR GILLIS IS THE BEST THING TO HAPPEN TO THIS UNIVERSITY. I have never had a professor I genuinely loved here. He is BRILLIANT and makes class so interesting. This class was 2 hours long and not once did I get bored. That absolutely never happens to me in a class. His teaching style is perfect and he cares about his students. TAKE HIS CLASS!

This is honestly one of the best classes I've taken.  Colin is really chill.  A huge portion of this class was graded for a community based volunteer component.  No tests on the reading.  There were weekly journal entries and two essays.  The grading wasn't harsh at all.  Participation was important, but not hard to get.  Easy and fun A.

The only problem I had with this class was that he didn't post grades throughout the semester but instead just gave a final grade.  He was extremely helpful when writing my final paper and his class has changed the way I see myself in the world.  Amazing class! Would definitely take again!!
I took 216 with Colin Gillis a few years ago. Took it because it was required, but...Summed up HE IS AWESOME TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM. I came away after the class really enjoying the material.

I don't know why so many people are criticizing Professor Gillis's social skills. He is very approachable and is a joy to talk to. I have learned so much from him. I would recommend his class to anyone. Even if you don't have him as a professor, he seems like a great professor to get to know.

Professor Gillis is theoretically a great professor with brilliant things to say about each text, but he sorely lacks the social skills to interact with his students one-on-one in a productive manner.

Fun in class and a reasonably good lecturer, but focuses a bit too much on class discussion. He likes us to discuss amongst ourselves, but frankly doesn't teach enough. I didn't find him very helpful in a one on one setting, but good for people who want to take a reasonably easy class.
Gillis picks fascinating texts and gives amazing lectures. I wish more professors were like him.
Colin Gillis is the ideal professor. He's witty, quirky, and amazingly intelligent. I hope to take more classes with him in the future! He is definitely in touch with the issues of our era.

Gillis is the bomb.  I've taken Eng. 216 with him and made me want to take more courses with him.  He is even better at a small class scale and definitely knows what he is talking about. Requirements: attendance, Three papers, presentation, participation.I highly recommend him.  He's definitely one of my favorite professors at UW-Madison.

Professor Gillis is not the greatest lecturer in the beginning but his power points definitely helps.  His exams are EXTREMELY easy, as long as you show up to class and study your notes you'll do great! I definitely recommend taking this class with Prof. Gillis. Mike O. as TA is the greatest!
Not the greatest lecturer, but extremely intelligent and thought provoking. TA run, so grades based on them, but overall a great professor.
He played parliament before lecture! gillis is way chill-is, and i find his classes very interesting
